title: Cloudrock Waterproof Hiking Boot: Ultimate Guide for Trail Enthusiasts 2025
description: Complete guide to Cloudrock waterproof hiking boots featuring detailed reviews, comparisons, and expert insights for outdoor adventurers seeking the perfect trail footwear.
head:

    <title>Cloudrock Waterproof Hiking Boot: Ultimate Guide for Trail Enthusiasts 2025</title>
    <meta name="description" content="Complete guide to Cloudrock waterproof hiking boots featuring detailed reviews, comparisons, and expert insights for outdoor adventurers seeking the perfect trail footwear.">

      },
      "publisher": {
        "@type": "Organization",
        "name": "Explore National Parks Store"
      },
      "keywords": "cloudrock waterproof hiking boot, On Running hiking boots, waterproof hiking shoes, cloudrock 2 review",
      "wordCount": "2800",
      "articleSection": "Hiking Gear",
      "mainEntity": {
        "@type": "FAQPage",
        "@id": "#faq"
      }
    }
    </script>
    <script type="application/ld+json">
    {
      "@context": "https://schema.org",
      "@type": "FAQPage",
      "mainEntity": [
        {
          "@type": "Question",
          "position": 1,
          "name": "Are Cloudrock waterproof hiking boots truly waterproof?",
          "acceptedAnswer": {
            "@type": "Answer",
            "text": "Yes, Cloudrock waterproof hiking boots feature On's proprietary waterproof membrane that provides reliable protection against water penetration. However, like all waterproof footwear, the membrane's effectiveness can diminish over time with heavy use, typically after 150-200 miles of hiking."
          }
        },
        {
          "@type": "Question",
          "position": 2,
          "name": "How do Cloudrock boots compare to traditional hiking boots?",
          "acceptedAnswer": {
            "@type": "Answer",
            "text": "Cloudrock boots are lighter and more flexible than traditional hiking boots, weighing around 2 pounds 4 ounces compared to 2 pounds 8 ounces for conventional boots. They offer less ankle support and durability but provide superior comfort and agility on well-maintained trails."
          }
        },
        {
          "@type": "Question",
          "position": 3,
          "name": "What terrain is best suited for Cloudrock waterproof hiking boots?",
          "acceptedAnswer": {
            "@type": "Answer",
            "text": "Cloudrock waterproof hiking boots excel on well-maintained trails, rocky terrain, and day hikes. They're ideal for fast hiking, speed hiking, and light backpacking with packs under 30 pounds. However, they're less suitable for technical terrain, muddy conditions, or heavy backpacking."
          }
        },
        {
          "@type": "Question",
          "position": 4,
          "name": "How should I size Cloudrock waterproof hiking boots?",
          "acceptedAnswer": {
            "@type": "Answer",
            "text": "Most hikers should size up half a size from their street shoe size for Cloudrock boots. The boots have a standard fit with adequate toe room. If you have wide feet or plan to use thick hiking socks, consider sizing up a full size for optimal comfort."
          }
        },
        {
          "@type": "Question",
          "position": 5,
          "name": "What's the expected lifespan of Cloudrock waterproof hiking boots?",
          "acceptedAnswer": {
            "@type": "Answer",
            "text": "With regular use, Cloudrock waterproof hiking boots typically last 300-500 miles of hiking. The waterproofing may begin to fail around 150-200 miles. Factors affecting lifespan include terrain type, frequency of use, and maintenance practices like proper cleaning and waterproofing treatments."
          }
        }
      ]
    }
    </script>

body:
Cloudrock Waterproof Hiking Boot: Ultimate Guide for Trail Enthusiasts 2025

After logging over 200 miles in various Cloudrock models across challenging terrains from the Rocky Mountains to Pacific Northwest trails, I've compiled this comprehensive guide to help you understand whether the Cloudrock waterproof hiking boot is the right choice for your outdoor adventures. Whether you're a weekend warrior or serious trail enthusiast, this detailed analysis covers everything you need to know about On Running's innovative hiking footwear. Explore more hiking gear at our store.

Table of Contents

  • • Introduction to Cloudrock Technology
  • • Key Features and Technology
  • • Real-World Performance Testing
  • • Cloudrock Models Comparison
  • • My Personal Experience
  • • Pros and Cons Analysis
  • • Frequently Asked Questions
  • • Final Recommendations

Introduction to Cloudrock Technology

The Cloudrock waterproof hiking boot represents On Running's ambitious entry into the outdoor footwear market, bridging the gap between traditional hiking boots and modern trail running technology. Having spent considerable time testing various models across different terrains and conditions, I can confidently say that these boots occupy a unique niche in the hiking world.

What sets Cloudrock boots apart is their innovative CloudTec cushioning system, originally developed for road running but adapted for trail use. The hollow pods compress upon impact and then spring back, providing what On calls "running on clouds." This technology, combined with waterproof membranes and aggressive outsoles, creates a hiking boot that feels more like an athletic shoe than traditional leather mountain boots.

During my extensive field testing across the On Cloudrock 2 waterproof and original models, I've discovered that these boots excel in specific conditions while having clear limitations in others. Understanding these strengths and weaknesses is crucial for making an informed purchasing decision, especially given their premium price point of $220-240.

Key Innovation Points

  • CloudTec Technology: Hollow pods for cushioning and energy return
  • Missiongrip Outsole: Designed for technical terrain traction
  • Waterproof Membrane: Proprietary breathable waterproofing
  • Lightweight Construction: 20-30% lighter than traditional hiking boots
Check Latest Cloudrock Prices on Amazon

Key Features and Technology

CloudTec Cushioning System

The signature CloudTec pods provide exceptional underfoot comfort while maintaining responsiveness. Unlike traditional EVA foam, these hollow chambers compress individually, adapting to different terrain surfaces.

  • 18 individual cloud pods for targeted cushioning
  • Lightweight construction reduces overall boot weight
  • Enhanced energy return during uphill climbs

Waterproof Protection

On's proprietary waterproof membrane offers reliable protection against water penetration while maintaining breathability better than many Gore-Tex alternatives.

  • Seam-sealed construction prevents water ingress
  • Breathable membrane reduces foot overheating
  • Effective protection for stream crossings and wet conditions

The Cloudrock waterproof hiking boots incorporate several technical innovations that distinguish them from both traditional hiking boots and trail running shoes. The Missiongrip outsole features a unique lug pattern designed specifically for mixed terrain, with deeper heel lugs for braking on steep descents and more aggressive forefoot lugs for climbing traction.

During my testing of the Cloudrock 2 waterproof model, I found the updated construction addresses many of the durability concerns from the original version. The reinforced toe cap provides better protection against rock strikes, while the improved lacing system offers more secure foot retention during technical sections.

Construction and Materials

The upper construction utilizes a combination of synthetic materials designed to balance durability, weight, and breathability. The toe and heel areas feature reinforced panels to withstand abrasion from rocks and roots, while the midfoot sections use lighter, more flexible materials for comfort during long hiking days.

Weight Comparison Table

Boot Model Weight (Men's 9) Category
Cloudrock Waterproof 2 lbs 4 oz Lightweight
Traditional Hiking Boot 2 lbs 8 oz Midweight
Trail Running Shoe 1 lb 8 oz Ultralight
Shop Women's Cloudrock 2 Waterproof

Real-World Performance Testing

Over six months of rigorous testing across diverse terrain types, I've evaluated the Cloudrock waterproof hiking boot in conditions ranging from Pacific Northwest rainforests to arid Southwest desert trails. This comprehensive field testing reveals both the strengths and limitations of On's unique approach to hiking footwear.

Traction and Grip Performance

The Missiongrip outsole performs admirably on rock and hardpacked trail surfaces, providing confident traction during technical scrambles and steep sections. However, performance in muddy conditions is notably weaker than traditional Vibram outsoles. The relatively shallow lug depth (4mm) limits grip in loose soil and wet conditions.

Rock/Hardpack

9/10

Excellent grip and stability on rocky terrain and packed dirt trails.

Mud/Loose Dirt

6/10

Adequate but not exceptional in muddy or loose soil conditions.

Wet Rock

7/10

Good performance on wet rock with careful foot placement required.

Waterproof Performance Analysis

The waterproof membrane in On Cloudrock waterproof models provides reliable protection during stream crossings and light precipitation. During testing in Olympic National Park's notorious wet conditions, my feet remained dry during 6-hour hikes in steady drizzle.

However, breathability becomes compromised during high-intensity hiking, particularly in temperatures above 70°F. The proprietary membrane, while effective at keeping water out, doesn't match the breathability of premium Gore-Tex constructions. This limitation is most noticeable during summer hiking in humid conditions.

Comfort and Fit Evaluation

The comfort factor of Cloudrock hiking boots stands out as their primary strength. The CloudTec cushioning system provides exceptional underfoot comfort, reducing fatigue during long hiking days. The break-in period is minimal, typically requiring only 10-15 miles of wear before achieving optimal comfort.

Sizing runs true to traditional On Running shoes, with most hikers finding their standard size appropriate. The toe box provides adequate width for most foot shapes, though those with particularly wide feet may need to size up half a size. The heel cup provides secure retention without excessive pressure points.

Explore All Terrain Hiking Options

Cloudrock Models Comparison

On Running offers several variants within the Cloudrock family, each targeting different hiking styles and conditions. Understanding the differences between models is crucial for selecting the right boot for your specific needs. Having tested multiple variants, I can provide detailed insights into their respective strengths and applications.

Complete Model Comparison

Model Height Weight Price Best For
Cloudrock Original Low 1 lb 14 oz $200 Day hiking, trail running
Cloudrock 2 Mid 2 lb 2 oz $220 Light backpacking, day hikes
Cloudrock 2 Waterproof Mid 2 lb 4 oz $240 Wet conditions, all-weather hiking
Cloudrock Women's Waterproof Mid 1 lb 15 oz $240 Women-specific fit, wet weather

Key Differences and Applications

The On Running Cloudrock original remains the lightest option, ideal for fast hiking and trail running applications. The low-cut design provides maximum mobility but offers minimal ankle support for technical terrain. This model excels on well-maintained trails and shorter day hikes where weight savings are prioritized over protection.

The Cloudrock 2 represents the most versatile option in the lineup, offering improved durability and construction over the original. The mid-cut height provides moderate ankle support without the weight penalty of traditional hiking boots. This model strikes an excellent balance for hikers who want protection and performance without excessive bulk.

For wet-weather hiking, the Cloudrock waterproof hiking boots provide essential moisture protection while maintaining the signature CloudTec comfort. The waterproof membrane adds minimal weight while significantly expanding the boot's versatility across different weather conditions.

Model Selection Tips

  • Choose Original Cloudrock for speed hiking and trail running
  • Select Cloudrock 2 for versatile day hiking and light backpacking
  • Opt for Waterproof versions in wet climates or year-round use
  • Consider women-specific models for better fit and performance

My Personal Experience

200+ Miles of Real-World Testing

My journey with Cloudrock waterproof hiking boots began during a challenging 3-day backpacking trip in the Cascade Range. Initially skeptical about On's entry into hiking footwear, I was curious to see how their running shoe technology would translate to trail use.

The first day covered 12 miles of mixed terrain, from riverside trails to rocky ridge walks. What immediately struck me was the exceptional comfort level – my feet felt fresh even after 8 hours of hiking, something I rarely experience with traditional boots.

Seasonal Performance Insights

Spring hiking in the Pacific Northwest provided the ultimate test for the waterproof capabilities of On Running Cloudrock waterproof boots. During a particularly wet weekend on the Olympic Peninsula, I encountered everything from stream crossings to muddy switchbacks and persistent drizzle.

The boots performed admirably in wet conditions, keeping my feet completely dry during multiple stream crossings and several hours of hiking in steady rain. However, I noticed breathability issues during more intensive uphill sections, leading to moisture buildup from internal perspiration rather than external water ingress.

Lessons Learned from Extended Use

After six months and over 200 miles of testing, several key insights emerged about the long-term performance of Cloudrock boots. The most significant discovery was their excellent performance on maintained trails and moderate terrain, but notable limitations on technical, off-trail terrain.

During a challenging scramble in the North Cascades, the boots' lack of rigid support became apparent on loose scree and technical rock sections. While the traction was adequate, the flexible construction didn't provide the confidence I needed for exposed traverses or heavy pack loads above 35 pounds.

Exceeded Expectations

  • Exceptional all-day comfort
  • Reliable waterproof performance
  • Minimal break-in period required
  • Excellent traction on rock
  • Lightweight for the protection offered

Areas for Improvement

  • Limited support for technical terrain
  • Breathability issues in warm weather
  • Shallow lugs struggle in mud
  • Premium pricing for synthetic construction
  • Not suitable for heavy pack loads

Ranger Recommendations and Local Insights

During conversations with park rangers in Olympic and Mount Rainier National Parks, I gained valuable insights about footwear recommendations for different trail conditions. Rangers consistently emphasized that On Cloud Cloudrock waterproof boots work well for day hikers on established trails but aren't ideal for backcountry or technical routes.

One experienced ranger noted that the lightweight construction appeals to speed hikers and trail runners transitioning to longer distances, but cautioned about durability concerns for frequent users. This insight proved accurate during my extended testing, where I observed faster-than-expected wear on high-friction areas.

Compare with Newton Ridge Hiking Boots

Pros and Cons Analysis

After extensive field testing and analysis of user reviews from Amazon, Reddit, and Quora, I've compiled a balanced assessment of the Cloudrock waterproof hiking boot's strengths and weaknesses. This analysis considers both my personal experience and feedback from dozens of other hikers.

Advantages

  • Exceptional Comfort: CloudTec cushioning provides all-day comfort with minimal break-in period
  • Lightweight Design: Significantly lighter than traditional hiking boots while maintaining mid-cut protection
  • Versatile Performance: Works well for both hiking and casual wear, making them excellent multi-purpose boots
  • Reliable Waterproofing: Proprietary membrane keeps feet dry in wet conditions with better breathability than many alternatives
  • Rock Traction: Excellent grip on rocky terrain and hardpacked trails
  • Quick Drying: Synthetic materials dry faster than leather alternatives
  • Stylish Design: Modern aesthetic appeals to urban hikers and outdoor enthusiasts

Disadvantages

  • Limited Technical Support: Insufficient ankle support for technical terrain or heavy pack loads
  • Premium Pricing: Expensive compared to traditional hiking boots with similar protection levels
  • Durability Concerns: Synthetic construction may not last as long as quality leather boots
  • Mud Performance: Shallow lugs provide limited traction in muddy or loose soil conditions
  • Breathability Issues: Can become warm and humid during high-intensity hiking
  • Limited Load Capacity: Not suitable for backpacking with loads exceeding 30-35 pounds
  • Waterproof Degradation: Membrane effectiveness may decline after 150-200 miles of use

User Review Summary

Analysis of over 150 user reviews across multiple platforms reveals consistent themes about Cloudrock walking boots performance. The most frequently praised aspects include comfort, lightweight construction, and waterproof reliability, while common criticisms focus on durability and limited technical capability.

Representative User Reviews

Amazon Reviewer (4/5 stars): "These boots are incredibly comfortable right out of the box. I've used them for 50+ miles of day hiking and they've been fantastic on rocky trails. The waterproofing works great, but they do get warm on hot days. Worth the investment for comfort alone."

Reddit r/hikinggear (Mixed review): "Love the comfort and weight, but had durability issues after 6 months. One eyelet started fraying and the waterproofing failed after about 150 miles. Great boots if you're not planning to use them heavily, but traditional boots might be better for frequent hikers."

Quora Hiking Community: "Switched from heavy Merrell boots to Cloudrock 2 Waterproof and couldn't be happier for my typical day hikes. They're not suitable for multi-day backpacking, but perfect for 8-12 mile day hikes on maintained trails. The traction on rock is excellent."

Who Should Consider Cloudrock Boots?

Ideal Candidates:

  • Day hikers prioritizing comfort
  • Speed hikers and fast packers
  • Trail runners seeking more support
  • Urban hikers wanting versatile footwear
  • Those with foot comfort issues

Better Alternatives For:

  • Technical mountaineering
  • Heavy backpacking (35+ lbs)
  • Frequent muddy conditions
  • Budget-conscious hikers
  • Extended multi-day treks
Explore Youth Cloudrock Options

Frequently Asked Questions

Are Cloudrock waterproof hiking boots truly waterproof?

Yes, Cloudrock waterproof hiking boots feature On's proprietary waterproof membrane that provides reliable protection against water penetration. During my extensive testing, including deliberate stream crossings and hiking in persistent rain, the boots kept my feet completely dry. However, like all waterproof footwear, the membrane's effectiveness can diminish over time with heavy use, typically after 150-200 miles of hiking. The waterproofing works best when the boots are properly maintained and treated with appropriate waterproofing products as needed. Users should also note that while the boots prevent external water from entering, internal moisture from perspiration can still accumulate during intense hiking sessions.

How do Cloudrock boots compare to traditional hiking boots?

Cloudrock boots are significantly lighter and more flexible than traditional hiking boots, weighing around 2 pounds 4 ounces compared to 2 pounds 8 ounces or more for conventional boots. They offer less ankle support and overall durability but provide superior comfort and agility on well-maintained trails. Traditional leather boots excel in technical terrain, heavy load carrying, and long-term durability, while Cloudrock boots shine in comfort, speed hiking, and versatility. The CloudTec cushioning system provides better underfoot comfort than most traditional boots, making them ideal for long day hikes. However, traditional boots offer superior protection for technical terrain, better load-carrying capacity for heavy packs, and typically longer lifespan with proper care. The choice depends on your hiking style, terrain preferences, and comfort priorities.

What terrain is best suited for Cloudrock waterproof hiking boots?

Cloudrock waterproof hiking boots excel on well-maintained trails, rocky terrain, and day hikes where agility and comfort are prioritized over maximum protection. They're ideal for fast hiking, speed hiking, and light backpacking with packs under 30 pounds. The Missiongrip outsole provides excellent traction on rock surfaces and hardpacked dirt trails, making them perfect for ridge walks and scrambles on solid surfaces. However, they're less suitable for technical terrain requiring rigid ankle support, muddy conditions where deeper lugs are needed, or off-trail bushwhacking where maximum protection is essential. The boots perform well on gravel paths, forest trails, and moderate elevation gains but struggle in loose scree, deep mud, or technical mountaineering situations. For best results, stick to established trails and day hiking scenarios.

How should I size Cloudrock waterproof hiking boots?

Most hikers should size up half a size from their street shoe size for Cloudrock boots, which is standard practice for hiking footwear to accommodate foot swelling and thicker socks. The boots have a standard fit with adequate toe room, but sizing can vary slightly between different Cloudrock models. During my testing, I found the fit to be true to On Running's standard sizing, which tends to run slightly narrow compared to some hiking boot brands. If you have wide feet or plan to use thick hiking socks, consider sizing up a full size for optimal comfort. The heel cup provides secure retention without excessive pressure points, but those with particularly narrow heels might experience some slippage. I recommend trying them on in the afternoon when feet are naturally more swollen to ensure proper fit during actual hiking conditions.

What's the expected lifespan of Cloudrock waterproof hiking boots?

With regular use, Cloudrock waterproof hiking boots typically last 300-500 miles of hiking, which translates to 1-2 years for average hikers or 6-12 months for frequent users. The waterproofing may begin to fail around 150-200 miles, which is earlier than some premium alternatives but typical for lightweight synthetic boots. Factors affecting lifespan include terrain type (rocky surfaces cause faster wear), frequency of use, hiking style, and maintenance practices like proper cleaning and waterproofing treatments. The synthetic upper materials are generally durable but don't age as gracefully as quality leather. The CloudTec sole pods tend to maintain their cushioning properties well throughout the boot's lifespan, though the Missiongrip outsole rubber may show wear on abrasive surfaces. Proper care, including regular cleaning, appropriate storage, and periodic waterproofing treatments, can extend the boots' effective lifespan and maintain their performance characteristics.

Final Recommendations

After 200+ miles of rigorous testing across diverse terrain and conditions, the Cloudrock waterproof hiking boot earns a solid recommendation for specific use cases while acknowledging clear limitations.

The Cloudrock waterproof hiking boot represents an excellent choice for hikers prioritizing comfort, versatility, and lightweight performance over maximum technical capability. These boots excel in their intended niche – day hiking, speed hiking, and light backpacking on well-maintained trails. The CloudTec cushioning system delivers exceptional all-day comfort that surpasses most traditional hiking boots, while the waterproof protection provides reliable weather resistance for year-round use.

However, serious backpackers, technical climbers, and budget-conscious hikers should consider alternatives. The premium pricing, limited load-carrying capacity, and durability concerns make them less suitable for intensive use or challenging terrain. Traditional hiking boots from established brands like Merrell, Salomon, or Lowa offer better value for technical applications, while newer lightweight options from Hoka or Adidas provide similar comfort benefits at lower prices.

Highly Recommended For

  • Day hikers (5-15 miles)
  • Speed hiking enthusiasts
  • Trail-to-town versatility seekers
  • Comfort-prioritizing hikers
  • Well-maintained trail hiking

Consider Carefully For

  • Moderate backpacking
  • Variable terrain hiking
  • Frequent use scenarios
  • Muddy trail conditions
  • Premium budget allocation

Not Recommended For

  • Technical mountaineering
  • Heavy backpacking (35+ lbs)
  • Budget-conscious purchases
  • Off-trail bushwhacking
  • Intensive daily use

Model Selection Guide

For those committed to the Cloudrock platform, choose the Cloudrock 2 for improved durability and construction, or the Cloudrock 2 waterproof for year-round versatility. Women hikers should consider the women's specific waterproof models for optimal fit and performance.

Ultimately, the Cloudrock waterproof hiking boot delivers on its promise of comfortable, lightweight hiking performance for the right user. While they may not replace traditional hiking boots for all applications, they represent a compelling option for modern hikers seeking comfort, style, and versatility in their outdoor footwear. The investment is justified for hikers who value comfort above all else and primarily stick to established trails and moderate terrain.

Shop Men's Cloudrock Boots
